results.title: Operation outback survey
results.brief_description: A geographical and physical survey of uncharted land in the Northern Territory by the Royal Australian Survey Corps. Working from a base, parties go inland by road and track, waterways and air. Field parties are set up and radio contact is established. Surveys are carried out with the aid of light aircraft. Work completed, men and equipment are moved to coastal areas by helicopter and ship. On completion of the survey all information is sent back to Headquarters and another area of Australia is put on the map.

results.creator_credit: Anthony Clay and Royal Society for the Protection of Birds Film Unit
results.brief_description: Ospreys returned to breed in Scotland very recently and the film shows the Society’s protection work which helped several pairs to breed successfully.

results.title: Operation navy help
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Defence. Public Relations
results.brief_description: Shows the Navy’s role in the monumental task of clearing up and restoring safety to Darwin in the aftermath of Cyclone Tracy. The first help to arrive to the stricken city was HMAS Brisbane with one thousand men and tons of food and other supplies. Shows naval personnel cleaning up rotting food and debris, evacuating citizens, guarding valuables and property and making buildings safe to use.

results.title: Operation Hurricane
results.creator_credit: Ronald Stark, Stuart Legg and Great Britain. Ministry of Supply
results.brief_description: When the British atomic weapons were tested in the Monte Bello Islands off North West Australia, detailed film records were kept of all stages of the operation. Stuart Legg has produced a dramatic documentary, despite a heavy veil of secrecy over much of the material. At Monte Bello, an advance party of British and Australian engineers prepared a site in the remote and barren island. Two months before zero day the main convoy arrived, together with HMS ‘Plym’, the target vessel with the bomb already in position in her hold. The rafter the work of setting up instruments proceeded rapidly. The experiment approached its climax with the arming of the firing mechanism, and reached it finally with the detonation of the bomb. The film concludes by showing the devastation caused by the explosion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ronald Stark, Stuart Legg and Great Britain. Ministry of Supply

results.title: Operation grasshopper
results.creator_credit: Tony Doogood and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: How the 1953 grasshopper plague in Northern Victoria was dealt with. Close-ups of Australian plague grasshopper; story of the disastrous plague in 1934, and later plagues; how farmers, armed services, and airlines cooperated in locating swarms and egg-beds and in aerial spraying of insecticide over the 1953 swarms.

results.title: Operation flash: an exercise, October 1977
results.creator_credit: Ingo Helbig, VicRail and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Film report of a simulated rail accident in Parkville. Four wooden carriages are blocked in the subway and inflammable liquids have been spilt. The role of the fire brigade, the ambulance and the police is shown in coping with the accident.

results.title: Operation Bala Lagin
results.creator_credit: Stanley Brogden and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force
results.brief_description: During 1956, a squadron of Australian built Canberra Jet Bombers visited the United States on a good-will mission. In the United States the airmen took part in the armed forces day parade in Washington, saw a demonstration of American aircraft, including the latest highspeed planes and jet bombers; visited Randolph Field, the USAF Medical Center, and took part in an annual ceremony commemorating the first flight across the Pacific by Kingsford-Smith and Ulm.

results.title: Operation and care of the Victor projector
results.brief_description: Explains by use of close-up photography the construction, threading, operation and care of the Victor 16 millimetre sound projector. Illustrates correct procedures for cleaning and lubricating the projector.

results.title: Operation and care of the Bell and Howell projector
results.brief_description: Close-ups show how to thread and operate the Bell and Howell 16 millimetre sound projector. Also shown is the correct method for setting up the equipment. Stresses the importance of proper maintenance and care. Bell and Howell Filmosound models 179 and 185 are used in the demonstration.
